attributes.action: Objection to the planning application submitted to the South Hams District Council to build 50 homes at Rowes Farm in Stoke Gabriel, South Devon, which is prime agricultural land in an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Stoke Gabriel is a beautiful, small historic village with a unique setting on the River Dart, popular with tourists and local visitors.

Midas Homes plan to build 50 houses on 1.5 ha, destroying ancient Devon banks and hedgerows and displacing many protected fauna.
 
Access is via a frequently congested class 3 road; increasing the existing frustration and danger to pedestrians and inhibiting emergency services access. There is no infrastructure or jobs to support this large development. 

It is outside the permitted development area. South Hams District Council should uphold their planning policy and stop this inappropriate development.  

Allowing the building of expensive houses for open market sale on AONB designated agricultural land, will set a dangerous precedent.

Over 600 signatures (~70% of village population) against this development has been handed to South Hams Council - surely the voice of local people speaking.

We need wider support. Please sign our ePetition.
